channel.title: Utorrent - Problems
channel.description:
Hi, I am having problems with Utorrent (using it for the private server). I have followed the TUT on how to use Utorrent and skip the portfowarding part on making servers. (TUT by danielknuckles). I have followed all the steps completely, but still I get error connecting to server... On Utorrent it says i have Listen Error (Firewall is blocking Utorrent). How do I get my firewall to stop blocking these things. I have worked all morning to get this firewall to stop blocking these ports. I have: Gone to the exeptions list on the firewall for windows (on the computer that the firewall router is hooked up to, I am running a ethernet to the firewall router) and made a exeption for port 43594. I have done the same on this computer as well. I have made a rule for Norton Internet Security 2008 (my optional firewall) to allow port 43594 (inbound connections only). What am I doing wrong? I am eager to get this server running. I have spent 2 days working on this, but this firewall is setting me back.
Thanks,
Fluster

item.title: Utorrent - Problems
item.dc:creator: @danielknuckles danielknuckles
item.description:
@danielknuckles wrote:

That is why I said in my tut to have another firewall such as comodo or zonealarm.

MAKE SURE YOU HAVE ANOTHER FIREWALL SUCH AS COMODO OR ZONEALARM

Read full topic

item.title: Utorrent - Problems
item.dc:creator: @ProjectDiabolus ProjectDiabolus
item.description:
@ProjectDiabolus wrote:

Turning your firewall is a horrible idea. Honestly if you do that, you can get hacked so damn easy.

Read full topic

item.title: Utorrent - Problems
item.dc:creator: @danielknuckles danielknuckles
item.description:
@danielknuckles wrote:

Did you make sure that you had Windows firewall turned off? And also try removing the check-mark from block all incoming connections
But if that doesn’t work, put the check-mark back.

firwll11.jpg445×515

Read full topic

item.title: Utorrent - Problems
item.dc:creator: @fluster fluster
item.description:
@fluster wrote:

Yah, Sorry about that last section.

Read full topic
